posts.name: Olav
posts.cooked:
Please add JPEG XL support to all versions of Signal. As in the ability to decode/view, send and receive.

Why JPEG XL:

  • https://jpegxl.info/why-jxl.html

Adoption:

  • libjxl/software_support.md at main · libjxl/libjxl · GitHub
  • JPEG XL - Wikipedia

Telegram Desktop recently got support for both AVIF and JPEG XL:

  • AVIF, JPEG XL, HEIF support in Windows build by novomesk · Pull Request #25572 · telegramdesktop/tdesktop · GitHub
  • Install gyp python dependencies in prepare.py by ilya-fedin · Pull Request #25585 · telegramdesktop/tdesktop · GitHub

It’s an open image standard, there’s no much exploiting to be done with it, just with the implementation, and I’m pretty sure the libjxl implementation has been quite thoroughly tested.
Although several more eyes to go over the code sure wouldn’t hurt

posts.name: grosatowork@proton.me
posts.cooked: JPEG-XL interest seems to be quite strong despite Google’s insistance, which many cite to justify lack of support. Facebook, Adobe, Intel and the Video Electronics Standards Association, The Guardian, Flickr and SmugMug, Shopify, the Krita Foundation, and Serif Ltd. all have come out endorsing JPEG-XL along with Cloudinary & Google’s research division.

posts.name: Daniel Novomeský
posts.cooked:
In KDE, we use libjxl via kimageformats package.
kimageformats is fuzzed via OSS-Fuzz and we see that libjxl is in good shape from security perspective.

It is not a single project on OSS-Fuzz which includes libjxl, others are testing it too.

posts.name: grosatowork@proton.me
posts.cooked: Apple recently announced ecosystem-wide support for JXL at WWDC. This means iPhones, iPads, Macs, Apple Watches, etc will all see JXL circulating without issue. Signal would be the exception rather than the rule not supporting JXL on an Apple platform.
It would result in a lot of issues though because Google doesn’t support it in Chromium, thus it wouldn’t work on Desktop at all, and I’m not sure what Android support looks like.

posts.name: grosatowork@proton.me
posts.cooked:
There are patches for Chromium that allow jxl to work flawlessly, and Signal’s Electron-based desktop client could implement these patches. The JXL team is very receptive to changes like this.

Android support isn’t entirely present, but apps like jxlviewer allow JXL images to be viewed without any problems. On Android, it is a matter of supporting it in the application.

JPEG XL (jxl) provides the best lossy compression at medium and high fidelity and the best lossless compression, its also made to be consistent and very fast even on ancient hardware. An important feature for signal would be that it can losslessly transcode jpeg into jxl (usually saving around 20% space) and that is reversible. Bandwidth costs are important for signal and any service, and everything sent on signal is also copied inside signal’s app storage. So using jxl can be implemented to convert jpeg and png into jxl for significant (over time) in app storage and transport savings, and when a user wants to save it on their device it gets transcoded back into jpeg and thats the same quality as the jxl, and when jxl support is inevitably impleneted in android then those compatible users can just save the jxl directly and convert images without reversibility which should result in even smaller images.

Video format based image formats (webp, avif) are more complex and either underperform or are too slow. JPEG 1 (the original) lasted almost 30 years, JPEG XL is its successor with a lot of future proofing (like HDR and recompression resilience) and with its transcoding feature theres no reason to not use it. Its decoders should be able to also decode original jpeg. As a bonus, it can also wipe out the humongous GIF format as it can compress it to at least make it 30% smaller.

About software support, pretty much everyone except google’s chromium and android support jxl, and they will inevitably have to: JPEG XL image format · Issue #430 · web-platform-tests/interop · GitHub
Apple’s entire ecosystem supports it, microsoft is making an official add-on for it, linux supports it, adobe really likes it, nvidia, intel, facebook, many cdn’s, etc.

jpegxl.info

JPEG XL

Community home page for the JPEG XL image format and libjxl

link_counts.title: JPEG XL image format · Issue #430 · web-platform-tests/interop · GitHub

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Could this be possible on all platforms with ease?

There is libraries for iOS and Android but they dont have that transcoding feature yet (we should ask them if signal wants to actually do this, the maintainer said he would add it but only if there is demand like this), and for desktop you probably can bundle libjxl right?

link_counts.title: GitHub - awxkee/jxl-coder: JPEG XL (JXL) Decoder/Encoder library for Android
GitHub - libjxl/libjxl: JPEG XL image format reference implementation
GitHub - awxkee/jxl-coder-swift: Jpeg XL Decoder/Encoder viewer for iOS, MacOS. Swift

posts.cooked:
The newest libjxl version got a major performance boost, and they’re getting close to the 1.0 release if that tickles anything, though largely meaningless.

It’s the format which makes the most sense for Signal. The 0.10 release addressed an earlier memory usage problem. They’ve now implemented streaming encoding, such that the RAM buffer can be much smaller.

JPEG XL encoding is much quicker than AVIF, and also wins over AVIF in compression at acceptable qualities, thereby lowering Signal’s server costs.

AVIF can win with very low qualities, but they’re unacceptably low and unfortunately skew some benchmarks on the web where the sole focus is default parameters or arbitrarily chosen parameters, with no regards for actual image quality.

Theres a new article by the JPEG XL co creator: JPEG XL and the Pareto Front

This article points out that jxl is pretty much the most efficient format when comparing speed with compression ratio. It also showcases libjxl’s efficiency in other aspects like memory consuption. libjxl’s defaults are pretty much the best options in general so you dont really even have to configure it

Also keep in mind the spec of jxl is not so strict so what jxl and libjxl can do now is not nearly the best it can do

link_counts.title: JPEG XL and the Pareto Front

posts.cooked:
The android library got the transcoding feature: Release Release 2.0.0 · awxkee/jxl-coder · GitHub
